item.title: Approaches for enterprise virtualization
item.description: this article is still being edited, visit later fore more detailed information history and use cases of virtualisation A hypervisor is the solution that allows virtual machines to share host resources. Virtualisation allows for running multiple operating systems on a single physical host. This helps enhancing server utilisation and management. Consilidation is sharing the resources of a (big) server by multiple virtual machines, leading to reduced cost Paravartualisation Paravirtualization is a technique to improve the performance, the guest operating system has support for paravirtualization to work more efficiently with the hypervisor with less overhead.

item.title: Level up your KVM storage management with these tricks
item.description: Change the size of a disk (be cautious) qemu-img resize /path/to/disk.qcow2 50G Check disk info including the size reserved on disk and virtual size qemu-img info /path/to/disk.qcow2 Make disk sparse (free space that is allocated to the host but not used), use only when the machine is shut down virt-sparsify --in-place /path/to/disk.qcow2 Convert format of the disk qemu-img convert /path/to/disk.qcow2 -O raw /another/path/disk.img Create a new virtual machine virt-install --name=VMNAME --memory=2048 --vcpus=1 --import --disk path=disk.
